name: Vegetables! Quiz | Topics for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which vegetable does Bugs Bunny like to eat?
questions.explanation:
Carrot.

	Cartoon character Bugs Bunny is often seen munching on a carrot. This vegetable has a lovely orange color and is high in vitamin A. They're yummy cooked or raw.

questions.text: Which of the following options is a long, green, spear-shaped vegetable?
questions.explanation:
Asparagus.

	Asparagus is a spring vegetable and is grown in almost every continent. Asparagus is usually steamed, grilled or stir-fried and is very low in calories. It is high in many minerals, vitamins and amino acids.

questions.text: Which popular vegetable is often served mashed, baked, and French-fried?
questions.explanation:
Potato.

	Potatoes are a very versatile vegetable that can be cooked in many ways and are not usually eaten raw. They are one of the most important vegetables in the world and are packed with vitamins and minerals.

questions.text: Cauliflower is usually a crunchy white vegetable often served with cheese sauce.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Cauliflower looks a lot like broccoli except that it is white. It can be eaten raw or cooked and is often served with a melted cheese sauce. It is high in fiber and vitamin C. This unique vegetable is usually white in color, but there are green, orange, and even purple varieties of this vegetable.

Spinach.

	Spinach is a very nutritious vegetable that is known for being high in iron as well as most other vitamins and minerals. It can be used fresh in salads, or steamed, boiled, or baked in casseroles. This yummy vegetable is eaten all over the world.

questions.text: If you like to eat dill pickles (also known as gherkins), which of the following vegetables are you probably eating?
questions.explanation:
Cucumber.

	Pickles, also called gherkins, are simply pickled cucumbers. This vegetable, which comes in a variety of colors and sizes, is usually eaten pickled or raw but can be cooked in a variety of ways. It is known to cause many people to burp.

questions.text: Eggplant is a small yellow vegetable that looks like miniature carrots.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Eggplant is a large purple vegetable that is closely related to both the tomato and the potato. Eggplant is also call aubergine and originated in the country known as India. It can be cooked in many different ways and is not usually eaten raw.

questions.text: Which of these vegetables looks like baby cabbages?
questions.explanation:
Brussels Sprouts.

	The Brussels sprout is a type of cabbage that usually only grows no larger than a golf ball. They are high in vitamins K and C and are usually eaten steamed, stir-fried or boiled.

questions.text: Which crunchy green vegetable stalks are often served raw, stuffed with peanut butter?
questions.explanation:
Celery.

	Raw celery is often served with a sweetened peanut butter and cream cheese mixture. They are often diced and added to salads or cooked into soups. High in fiber, celery is said to aid in digestion.

questions.text: Which of the following is a small tangy red-skinned vegetable often served in salads?
questions.explanation:
Radish.

	Radishes are small zesty root vegetables with a strong flavor. While they can be eaten in many ways, they are usually eaten raw in salads. Their tangy white flesh is high in potassium, folic acid and calcium.
